parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>TRUE</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>TRUE. The post explicitly mentions "alegerile parlamentare din 1 decembrie" (parliamentary elections on December 1st) and encourages voters to choose candidates who will be their voice in Parliament. While it doesn't name a specific candidate, it strongly implies support for the USR party given the "USR Maramures" byline and the CMF number associated with Brian Cristian, a USR candidate.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>TRUE. This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed for wide public reach. The message is not a private communication but aims to influence a large audience.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>TRUE. The primary objective is to persuade voters to support candidates who will represent their interests in Parliament.  The phrases "vocea voastră în Parlament" (your voice in Parliament) and "să avem o România pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!" (let's have a Romania for everyone, not just for some!) are clear calls to action with an electoral purpose.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>FALSE. While the post presents some statistics, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting. The presentation of data serves to bolster the candidate's image and promote his candidacy, not to provide impartial information.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>FALSE. The post transcends personal opinion; it's a carefully crafted message designed to sway public opinion in favor of a specific political agenda and candidate.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1043264764266897</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, paid for by USR Maramures, promotes Brian Cristian, a USR candidate in the upcoming parliamentary elections.  The post uses statistics to highlight his achievements, directly linking them to the upcoming election. The call to action ("vote for candidates who will be your voice") and the overall tone clearly aim to influence voters' choices. The presence of a CMF number further confirms its nature as electoral propaganda.  While the post doesn't explicitly mention voting for Brian Cristian by name, the context and the byline leave no doubt about its intended effect. The spending of RON 400-499 and the reach of 6K-7K impressions indicate a significant effort to influence voters.  The post's timing, after the official campaign period, is also a potential violation.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>Brian Cristian</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări plătite pe Facebook (ID 1043264764266897) după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care promovează indirect candidatura lui Brian Cristian la alegerile parlamentare din 1 decembrie, folosind statistici pentru a-i evidenția realizările și îndemnând alegătorii să voteze candidați care le vor reprezenta interesele în Parlament.  Postarea, cu un buget de RON 400-499 și o audiență de 6.000-7.000 de impresii, are un efect electoral clar, având ca obiectiv influențarea votului în favoarea USR. Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă caracterul de propagandă electorală.  Fraze precum "vocea voastră în Parlament" și "să avem o România pentru toți, nu doar pentru unii!" constituie îndemnuri directe la vot, încalcând prevederile legale privind perioada de campanie electorală.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
